#Text=Maizuru
#Text=Maizuru ( 舞鶴 ) surrounds an inlet of the Sea of Japan , along the northeastern coast of Kyoto Prefecture .
#Text=Maizuru in Japanese means ' dancing crane ' .
#Text=Understand
#Text=One of the main port cities in Kyoto Prefecture .
#Text=Ferries to Niigata and on to Tomakomai in Hokkaido leave from here .
#Text=Maizuru consists of two parts : Nishi-Maizuru and Higashi-Maizuru .
#Text=Maizuru is a key district headquarters for the Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force .
#Text=By train
#Text=Higashi-Maizuru Station ( 東舞鶴 ) is served by eight limited express trains daily from Kyoto Station , six under the name Maizuru and two as Tango Discovery .
#Text=Fares for the 96-minute journey range from ¥ 3,250 for an unreserved seat to ¥ 3,960 for a reserved seat in peak season .
#Text=It is also possible to use local trains when traveling from Kyoto station for ¥ 1,890 .
#Text=The journey takes around 2 hours and you need to change trains at Sonobe and Ayabe .
#Text=By car
#Text=A trip by car takes around 1 hour 10-20 min from Kobe-Sando .
#Text=The ride from Itami airport takes approximately 1 hour 30 minutes .
#Text=It takes 1 hour 30 minutes to get to Maizuru from Kyoto city .
#Text=By bus
#Text=The bus company Kyoto Kotsu has buses running from Kyoto central train station to Higashi-Maizuru train station for ¥ 2,300 .
#Text=The journey takes around 2 hours .
#Text=The same bus company has buses going to Maizuru from Kobe and Osaka .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Shin-Nihonkai Ferry ( 新日本海フェリー )
#Text=This company has lines connecting daily to Otaru port at Hokkaido ( 21 h ) .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The city occupies a vast territory and public transportation is not well developed .
#Text=It is better to have a car .
#Text=It is also possible to arrange a taxi tour for around ¥ 5,000 .
#Text=Inquire about arranging a tour at the Maizuru tourist information center at Higashi-Maizuru station .
#Text=See
#Text=There is a nice view of the Maizuru bay from the quay which is a 10-15 minutes walk from Higashi-Maizuru train station .
#Text=Maizuru has many buildings made of red brick around town .
#Text=Some of them used to be military buildings , others warehouses , tunnels and even temples .
#Text=Maizuru also has a museum of red bricks .
#Text=Maizuru World Brick Museum .
#Text=The museum displays bricks from all over the world and all over Japan , as well as ancient ones from old Mesopotamia , Egypt , China , and Greece .
#Text=Do
#Text=Visit Japanese self-defence force base , Russo-Japanese War Museum including Admiral Togo museum , repatriation museum , brick museum .
#Text=Buy
#Text=The main shopping place in Maizuru is department store LaPort which is behind Higashi-Maizuru train station .
#Text=Drink
#Text=There is a very good yakitori close to train station Higashi-Maizuru on Sanjo-dori owned by an ex-self-defense sailor Daikichi who speaks some English .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Maizuru Port offers ferry services along the Sea of Japan up to Hokkaido .
